result.execSummary:
The defendant Tamika L Bridges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County with NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Enroll in program to get her GED.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any Kohl's Dept store or the co-actors.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED; to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tamika L Bridges in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge in the amended information. Court imposed the following sentence:

    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER, w/Standard Release Conditions  

TERM OF PROBATION:  12 months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Enroll in program to get her GED
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with the Kohls' Department store or the co-actors
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DRGOD:  $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 15 days jail, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Probation may be transfered to Milwaukee County with no electronic monitoring

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tamika L Bridges in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense just received Discovery and needs time to go over it with his client and does request a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on March 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Tamika L Bridges in court with attorney Zachary Hoff, for attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 02-02-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Tamika L Bridges in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant needs more time to obtain counsel.  Court will order defendant to apply to the Milwaukee County Public Defender's office today for services.  If it is not completed a warrant will issue for her arrest.  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tamika L Bridges
Current: 4706 W Keefe Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 01-19-2016)
Prior: 4706 W Keefe Ave, Milwaulkee, WI 53216
Hearing at 01-19-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Tamika L Bridges not in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant called to state she is in the hospital and not able to appear.  State requests capias stayed and hearing date given.  Court stays the issuance of a capias until next hearing.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 01-05-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Tamika L Bridges in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant needs additional time to seek counsel.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 10:00 am
Defendant to have no contact with co-defendants or any Kohl's Department stores.

Defendant Tamika L Bridges in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
